isis.stitle: CAB: DAYCAB AND SLEEPER CAB for ProStar, ProStar Premium, and ProStar Limited Models - REMOVE - CAB DOOR TRIM PANEL

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Door Trim Panel with Electric Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 33 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove two torx pan head screws (Item 1) and remove inner door pull cup (Item 2) from the cab door trim panel (Item 3), driver side shown.
Using a small blunt screwdriver, carefully pry courtesy light (Item 4) from map pocket trim panel (Item 5), driver side shown.
Once courtesy light (Item 4) is pulled from map pocket trim panel (Item 5) disconnect wiring harness connector (Item 6) from courtesy light and lay courtesy light out of the way, driver side shown.
Using a small blunt screwdriver, carefully pry map pocket trim panel (Item 5) from cab door trim panel (Item 3).

Once map pocket trim panel (Item 5) is pulled from cab door trim panel (Item 3) disconnect wiring harness connector (Item 7) from cab door Speaker (Item 8) and lay map pocket trim panel out of the way, driver side shown.
Remove two torx pan head bolts (Item 9) and remove grab handle (Item 10) and lay grab handle out of the way, driver side shown.
Using a small blunt screwdriver, carefully pry cab door trim panel (Item 3) from cab door (Item 11), driver side shown.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 34 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once cab door trim panel (Item 1) has been pulled away from Cab door (Item 2), driver side shown.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 35 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: With the cab door trim panel (Item 1) being held away from the cab door (Item 2), disconnect electrical connector (Item 3) from electric window and door lock switch (Item 4). If so equipped, disconnect electrical connector (Item 5) from electric mirror switch (Item 6). Lay cab door trim panel on a padded surface and save for installation, driver side shown.

figure.caption: Figure 35. Cab Door Trim Panel Electrical Connectors

calloutgroup.callout1: 4. ELECTRIC WINDOW AND DOOR LOCK SWITCH

step1.para: Repeat procedure to remove passenger side cab door trim panel with electric door window and locks.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Door Trim Panel with Manual Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 36 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Remove two torx pan head screws (Item 1) and remove inner door pull cup (Item 2) from the cab door trim panel (Item 3), driver side shown.
Using a small blunt screwdriver, carefully pry courtesy light (Item 4) from map pocket trim panel (Item 5), driver side shown.
Once courtesy light (Item 4) is pulled from map pocket trim panel (Item 5) disconnect wiring harness connector (Item 6 from courtesy light and lay courtesy light out of the way, driver side shown.
Using a small blunt screwdriver, carefully pry map pocket trim panel (Item 5) from cab door trim panel (Item 3).

Once map pocket trim panel (Item 5) is pulled from cab door trim panel (Item 3) disconnect wiring harness connector (Item 7) from cab door Speaker (Item 8) and lay map pocket trim panel out of the way, driver side shown.
Remove two torx pan head bolts (Item 9) and remove grab handle (Item 10) and lay grab handle out of the way, driver side shown.

Push cab door trim panel (Item 3) in at the window regulator handle shaft (Item 11). Using the proper removal tool, remove retaining clip (Item 12) securing window regulator handle (Item 13) to the window regulator handle shaft. Remove window regulator handle. Lay retaining clip and window regulator handle out of the way and save for installation, driver side shown.
Using a small blunt screwdriver, carefully pry cab door trim panel (Item 3) from cab door (Item 14), driver side shown.

figure.caption: Figure 36. Cab Door Trim Panel Fasteners and Window Regulator Handle

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 34
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Lift cab door trim panel (Item 1) up and away from cab door (Item 2). Lay cab door trim panel on a padded surface and save for installation, driver side shown.
Repeat procedure to remove passenger side cab door trim panel with manual door window and locks.
